intro: Corydalis spinulosa, commonly known as the prickly corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or woodland habitats and produces clusters of pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and it has distinctive, spurred petals that aid in pollination. Corydalis spinulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
